paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for TTR gene variants Val122Ile, Leu58His, and late-onset Val30Met, including penetrance data.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Most patients with V122I were diagnosed based on cardiac symptoms, while many had clinically meaningful PN that preceded or was contemporaneous with cardiac symptoms.

functional_data.summary: Patients with V122I showed significant reductions in sensory and motor nerve amplitudes.

variants.population_frequency: 3%–4% of Black individuals in the United States.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical presentation and family history.
variants.additional_notes: V122I is the most common pathogenic variant in the United States.
key_quotes: V122I is perceived to be a cardiac disease, PN is common and clinically relevant.
Patients with V122I progressed at approximately half the rate of patients with V30M and L58H.

patients.demographics: Mean age 62.4 ± 9.8 years; 31% female; all White

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patients with L58H presented predominantly with neuropathy and little cardiac involvement but often had GI involvement.

functional_data.summary: Patients with L58H showed significant reductions in nerve fiber densities.

variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical presentation.
variants.additional_notes: L58H showed the highest level of GI involvement.
key_quotes: Patients with L58H showed the highest level of GI involvement with 54% of patients affected.

patients.demographics: Mean age 64.8 ± 2.6 years; 25% female; 67% White, 17% Asian, 17% Hispanic or Latino

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patients with V30M presented after the age of 50 years, had advanced PN during diagnosis.

functional_data.summary: Patients with V30M experienced the greatest reduction in both sensory and motor nerve amplitudes.

variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical presentation.
variants.additional_notes: V30M showed a variable pattern of presentation.
key_quotes: Patients with V30M presented after the age of 50 years, had advanced PN during diagnosis.

tables_processed.table_caption: Demographics and clinical characteristics of patients with TTR variants.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for TTR variants were successfully extracted.
